handist.mpijunit

Class Configuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • handist.mpijunit.Configuration

  • public class Configuration
extends Object
    Contains various String constants used to define the behavior of the MpiRunner.

    Some settings (such as the number of MPI processes to use) are specific to each test class and need to be specified using the MpiConfig annotations on your individual test classes. They cannot be set using the options presented in this class.

    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty

    • Field Detail

      • ACTION_ON_ERROR

        public static final String ACTION_ON_ERROR
        Option defining what should be done in case the MpiRunner encounters an Exception when running the tests. These usually happen due to classpath issues or the unavaibility of the mpirun command. This option does not change the results of the tests that run. It is here to decide what to present if the MpiRunner was unable to run the tests successfully.

        This option should be set with -Dmpirunner.actionOnError=action. Possible actions are:

        • "error" which will marks the tests results as "error". This is the default behavior.
        • "skip" which will mark the tests as skipped (as if they were marked with the @Ignore annotation inside your test class).
        • "silent" which does not transmit any result for the tests
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_ERROR_ERROR

        public static final String ON_ERROR_ERROR
        Possible setting for ACTION_ON_ERROR, shows tests as "Error"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_ERROR_SILENT

        public static final String ON_ERROR_SILENT
        Possible setting for ACTION_ON_ERROR, does not show any result
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ON_ERROR_SKIP

        public static final String ON_ERROR_SKIP
        Possible setting for ACTION_ON_ERROR, shows tests as "Skipped"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_ON_ERROR_DEFAULT

        public static final String ACTION_ON_ERROR_DEFAULT
        Default action for ACTION_ON_ERROR, is ON_ERROR_ERROR
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DRY_RUN

        public static final String DRY_RUN
        Command line option to choose whether the mpirun process should actually be launched. Can be set by the JVM argument -Dmpirunner.dryRun=true/false. By default, it is set to false, meaning that the MpiRunner will try to launch multiple processes to run the tests.

        However, if this option is set to true, the MpiRunner will only attempt to parse the Notification recordings. In addition, the recordings will be kept on the file system regardless of what is set for option KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS.

        This option can be useful if you want to parse the test results from a different system on your local machine which may not be equipped with the software needed to run the tests.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DRY_RUN_DEFAULT

        public static final String DRY_RUN_DEFAULT
        Default setting for DRY_RUN
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • JAVA_LIBRARY_PATH

        public static final String JAVA_LIBRARY_PATH
        Command line option used to define the -Djava.library.path option of the mpi process launched by the MpiRunner. Set it by defining -Dmpirunner.javaLibraryPath=path/to/native/libs. This setting has no default value. If it is not set, no particular java library path will be set for the processes launched by the MpiRunner.

        If you are using using a native implementation of MPI to run your tests, you almost certainly need to specify this option.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPI_IMPL

        public static final String MPI_IMPL
        Command line option to define the MPI implementation used to launch the mpi tests. Set this setting with -Dmpirunner.mpiImpl=implementation.

        Currently supported implementations are:

        • "native" which relies on the mpiJava library
        • "mpj-multicore" which uses the MPJ-Express "multicore" implementation. (default value)
        • "mpj-native" which uses the MPJ-Express "native" implementation.
        If you are using the MPI_IMPL_NATIVE implementation, you can use the "mpirunner.mpirunOptions" to specify options to the mpirun command.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPI_IMPL_NATIVE

        public static final String MPI_IMPL_NATIVE
        Possible option for the MPI implementation used to launch the tests. When using the native implementation, be mindful of the fact you will need to provide the path to the shared objects bindings to the MPI library you are using with JAVA_LIBRARY_PATH. You can also give additional arguments to the mpirun command by setting MPIRUN_OPTION.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPI_IMPL_MPJMULTICORE

        public static final String MPI_IMPL_MPJMULTICORE
        Possible option for the MPI implementation used to launch the tests.

        When using the MPJ multicore configuration, you will need to set MPJ_HOME as an environment variable as this is needed by the MPJ library to run correctly. We refer you to the MPJ Express website for downloads and documentation about this library.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPI_IMPL_MPJNATIVE

        public static final String MPI_IMPL_MPJNATIVE
        Possible option for the MPI implementation used to launch the tests.

        When using the MPJ native configuration, you will need to set MPJ_HOME as an environment variable. It is also expected that you have library mpj.jar and libnativempjdev.so in directory MPJ_HOME/lib. We refer you to the MPJ Express website for downloads and documentation about this library.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPI_IMPL_DEFAULT

        public static final String MPI_IMPL_DEFAULT
        Default setting for MPI_IMPL : "mpj-multicore"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MPIRUN_OPTION

        public static final String MPIRUN_OPTION
        Settings to give options to the mpirun command when a native MPI implementation id used. Use -Dmpirunner.mpirunOptions=some options to set it.

        By default, this option is not set (by default, no options are passed to the mpirun command except -np X where X is the number of processes requested by your test class, as defined in the MpiConfig annotation). You should not set option -np X using this option, it is done by the MpiRunner.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NOTIFICATIONS_PATH

        public static final String NOTIFICATIONS_PATH
        Option to specify the directory in which the notifications of each rank will be placed. Set it using -Dmpirunner.notificationsPath=directory/to/notifications. If you do not set this option, the working directory will be used.

        If the directory does not exist, it will be created. However, note that the recording files are deleted by default by the MpiRunner after they are parsed. To keep the recordings, you also need to set KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS to true.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS

        public static final String KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS
        Command line option used to choose whether the files containing the Notifications that are made to the RunNotifier in each of the MPI processes should be kept after the tests' execution. Set it by defining -Dmpirunner.keepNotifications=true/false. This option is set to false by default, meaning the notification files will deleted after they are parsed by the MpiRunner.

        This can be useful if you want to parse the results on a different system then the one they were executed on. For instance, you may find it convenient to run your tests on a server with this option set to true, download the notification recordings and parse the results on your personal machine using the DRY_RUN option.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS_DEFAULT

        public static final String KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS_DEFAULT
        Default setting for KEEP_NOTIFICATIONS, is "false" .
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PARSE_NOTIFICATIONS

        public static final String PARSE_NOTIFICATIONS
        Option used to parse only the results of a single rank. By default, the test results of all the processes are processed. By setting this option with a particular rank number, only the test results of this process will be parsed.

        For instance, -Dmpirunner.parseNotifications=0 will make the MpiRunner only look for the file with the test results of rank 0.

        NOTA BENE: although a single notification file will ever be processed by the MpiRunner when using this option, the usual notification file naming convention (with the rank of the process as a suffix) still applies. If you are implementing your own Launcher and using this option, you still need to observe this naming convention.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERBOSE

        public static final String VERBOSE
        Enables verbose output of the MpiRunner. Verbose output is disabled by default, it can be activated by setting this property to "true".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERBOSE_DEFAULT

        public static final String VERBOSE_DEFAULT
        Default value for property VERBOSE. Is "false".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
